metadata.title: CVE-2020-35533 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In LibRaw, an out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists within the"LibRaw::adobe_copy_pixel()" function (libraw\src\decoders\dng.cpp) whenreading data from the image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.4
libraw16 - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

digikam - 4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1
digikam-data - 4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1
digikam-private-libs - 4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1
kipi-plugins - 4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1
kipi-plugins-common - 4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1
showfoto - 4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libraw package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.18.8-1ubuntu0.4').
ufraw package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
darktable package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
digikam package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:5.6.0-0ubuntu10+esm1').
